intro: Phyllanthus lacteus, commonly known as the milky phyllanthus, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Asia. It is a shrub or small tree that typically grows to a height of 1–3 meters. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that are often pubescent and have a milky sap when broken. Its small white or yellowish flowers are clustered in dense inflorescences, and it produces small, fleshy fruits that contain a single seed. The plant is often found in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments.
